dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, are we actually okay with entire districts just deciding their own time? Like, totally separate from everyone else?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, like, are we actually okay with entire districts just deciding their own time? Like, totally separate from everyone else?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, yes! Exactly! When I first read this, I was like, wait, what?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, yes! Exactly! When I first read this, I was like, wait, what?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And the Deputy PM, Zhumangarin, he’s like, “Uh, not really overseeing it, but yeah, it’s good!”
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And the Deputy P M, Zhumangarin, he's like, Uh, not really overseeing it, but yeah, it's good!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Speaking on the Mazhilis sidelines, Zhumangarin noted that he is not currently overseeing the time zone issue but still shared his opinion. ... The deputy prime minister called the decision of some districts to switch to a "local time zone" the right one.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! How can it not be your job but you still have, like, a strong opinion on it? Clearly he's involved.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! How can it not be your job but you still have, like, a strong opinion on it? Clearly he's involved.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And he calls it a “local time zone,” but it’s really just… working hours, isn’t it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he calls it a local time zone, but it's really just... working hours, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The deputy prime minister called the decision of some districts to switch to a "local time zone" the right one. ... They have had the right to change working hours for a while now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It is just working hours! Like, they're starting an hour earlier. That’s not a time zone shift, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is just working hours! Like, they're starting an hour earlier. That's not a time zone shift, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! But he says it's "the right one." It will "resolve many issues."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! But he says it's the right one. It will resolve many issues.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The deputy prime minister called the decision of some districts to switch to a "local time zone" the right one. ... "I believe it will resolve many issues," he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, I mean, if it does resolve issues, then, uh, yeah, maybe.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, I mean, if it does resolve issues, then, uh, yeah, maybe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But issues for who? The villagers, or, like, the whole region trying to coordinate?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But issues for who? The villagers, or, like, the whole region trying to coordinate?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah, that’s fair. I'm thinking about Katon-Karagay, they're like 8 AM to 5:30 PM, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah, that's fair. I'm thinking about Katon-Karagay, they're like eight A M to five thirty p m, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As a reminder, on January 5, residents of 17 villages in the Katon-Karagay district switched to their own work schedule, with working hours from 08:00 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Mhmm. And then others, they’re just, like, an hour earlier. Starting March 5th.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mhmm. And then others, they're just, like, an hour earlier. Starting March fifth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starting March 5, residents of Zaysan, Kurchum, Tarbagatai, and Samar districts will also begin their workday one hour earlier.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Like Zaysan and Kurchum. It just sounds... messy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Like Zaysan and Kurchum. It just sounds... messy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starting March 5, residents of Zaysan, Kurchum, Tarbagatai, and Samar districts will also begin their workday one hour earlier.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Messy, but for some, I guess, maybe it’s better. Early light, an early finish.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Messy, but for some, I guess, maybe it's better. Early light, an early finish.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but for me, I’d be so confused. "Is that district on our time or their own time for a call?"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but for me, I'd be so confused. Is that district on our time or their own time for a call?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! It's like, uh, good luck scheduling a meeting!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! It's like, uh, good luck scheduling a meeting!
